data.title: Undergraduate Alumni
data.text:
Congratulations to Nuri Bhuiyan, HAA Class of ’22, who recently joined the architectural firm @JGNeukomm_Architecture. “I've really enjoyed my time here, I think because of the combination of interests that seems to drive the firm. The studio draws immensely from the world of the client and the history of the context in every design decision, and we often explore the set of experiential qualities, economic forces, and visual precedents underpinning our work, from architectural...

Read more about Nuri Bhuiyan (HAA Class of '22) at JG Neukomm Architecture

Ana María Delmar (@queenanamaria), HAA Class of ’21, is currently a student in the MA Curating the Art Museum program at the Courtauld Institute of Art. “As part of our MA, we curate an exhibition for the public in London, handling all aspects of the exhibition end-to-end. I am a co-curator of Good Morning, Midnight with my 12-person cohort. I was heavily involved in the technical/design and financial management aspects of the exhibition. I credit my comfort with architectural design and exhibition design to the HAA...

Read more about Ana María Delmar (HAA Class of ’21) co-curating exhibition "Good Morning, Midnight" at the Courtauld Institute of Art.

Alexandra Schwartz, HAA Class of ’94, is the Curator of Modern and Contemporary Art, Craft, and Design at Museum of Arts and Design, New York. Her newly curated exhibition, Craft Front & Center: Conversation Pieces, is open beginning June 1. It explores craft’s collaborative approach to learning and working by placing pioneering twentieth-century craft artists into dialogue with twenty-first century artists who are rethinking craft techniques and materials. Showcasing MAD’s permanent collection, the exhibition brings together more than sixty...

Read more about Alexandra Schwartz, Class of '94

Congratulations to Nancy P. Lin (HAA Class of '11) who will be joining the History of Art & Visual Studies faculty at Cornell beginning July 1st, 2024. Lin has been a Klarman Postdoctoral Fellow since 2021 and will continue on to a full-time tenure track Assistant Professorship this summer.

Lin specializes in modern and contemporary Chinese art and architecture with a particular interest in the relationship between art and urbanism. Studying contemporary Chinese art through a transregional perspective, her current book project, Art On-Site: Situating Global...

Read more about Nancy P. Lin (Class of '11) to Join History of Art Faculty at Cornell in Fall 2024

Congratulations to HAA Graduating Senior Erik Zou on winning the 2024 Taliesin Prize. This prize is awarded to three graduating seniors who best exhibit a spirit of intellectual adventure in their curricular paths as Harvard undergraduates.

"We are pleased to announce the winners of the 2024 Taliesin Prize. All three seniors exemplify the spirit of this unique award. These students are explorers: they made bold and insightful course selections; they persevered when they faced curricular challenges; and they took intellectual risks that led to exciting discoveries. It...

Read more about HAA Graduating Senior Erik Zou wins 2024 Taliesin Prize

We would like to congratulate graduating seniors David Shaw and Erik J. Zou on winning Hoopes Prizes for their respective theses: “Reclaiming the Parking Garage: A New Preschool for Cambridge”, and “Paint and Pixel: Reimagining Impressionist Color in Monet’s Rouen Cathedral Series through Statistics.”

The Hoopes Prize is annually conferred in recognition of outstanding scholarly research from undergraduate students. The prize is funded by the estate of Thomas T. Hoopes, Class of 1919, for the purpose of "promoting, improving, and enhancing the quality of education."

Jessica Yin graduated in 2001 with a concentration in HAA, and now works as a senior architect at the architectural firm SCB. “I focused on Architectural History and Theory, with the intention to apply to graduate school for Architecture. Thanks in large part to the guidance of HAA's academic advisor at the time, I was able to chart out a course for fulfilling prerequisites for application (including coursework at the GSD), as well as meet with current architecture students and working design professionals to better understand the field and profession. This was...

Read more about Jessica Yin, HAA Class of '01
